results.title: Speech and language disorders
results.creator_credit: Queensland. Dept. of Education. Media Services
results.brief_description: A comprehensive introduction to the work of speech therapists. Looks at speech and language disorders in children, such as, poor communication and stuttering; and the problems adults face after strokes and throat cancers. Suitable for teacher/tertiary level.

results.title: At 'Edge' with Judith Wright
results.creator_credit: Solrun Hoaas and Sync or Swim Documentaries
results.brief_description: A study of Judith Wright, her poetry and her links with the Australian landscape - in particular her relation to her property of “Edge” in Mangarlowe, N.S.W. Filmed at “Edge” in the Half-moon Wildlife District and featuring Roger Pulvers as the interviewer. Suitable for middle and upper secondary level.

results.title: Newton: the mind that found the future
results.creator_credit: George Kaczender, John Kemeny and International Cinemedia Center
results.brief_description: Looks at the life of Sir Isaac newton, his contributions to scientific knowledge and the implications of his work for present-day science. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: The Changing world of Charles Dickens
results.creator_credit: John irvin, Jonathan Hansen, Allan King and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Recreates scenes from “David Copperfield”, “Oliver Twist”, “Dombey and Son”, “Great Expectations” and “Hard Times” in order to illustrate how Dickens not only reflected the harshness of his times but sought to change the social inequities as well. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Does anybody need me anymore?
results.creator_credit: Paul Bogart and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Part of the “Being a woman” series. Observes the changes which occur in the marriage of a middle-aged couple when the wife decides to change her own lifestyle after her children are grown and gone. Raises issues regarding women’s roles, sex-role stereotyping, changing expectaions of the female role and the male perception of such topics.

results.title: The Mime of Marcel Marceau
results.creator_credit: Daniel Camus and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Scenes from various classes conducted by Marcel Marceau and the teachers of his school are intercut with actual performances including “The Maskmaker”, “The Painter” and “The Creation”. Looks at the work of Marcel Marceau, both private and public. it is in the private domain that we see the “other” side of him - that is to say, his everyday reality of teaching mime.

results.title: Pride and principle
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Searching for values: a film anthology”.
An extract from the feature film “Bridge on the River Kwai” in which Sir Alec Guiness as the Commanding Officer refuses to give in to the Japanese over the issue of not allowing his officers to work. Raises issues surrounding pride and its consequences. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: My country: right or wrong? [Extract from 'Summertree']
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Searching for values: a film anthology”.
An extract from the feature film “Summertree” produced by Kirk Douglas and directed by Anthony Newley. Raises issues concerning the individual, patriotism and family relationships. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Love to kill
results.creator_credit: Stanley Kramer and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Searching for values: a film anthology”.
Specially edited from “Bless the beasts and children”. Raises issues surrounding the right to kill, the right to carry and use firearms, and the morality of taking the law into your own hands. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: The Mole and the egg
results.brief_description: An animated children’s film about a mole who finds an abandoned hen’s egg and sets out to find the egg’s mother. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.
